title: ROIT WE NEED A DODGE FEATURE
body:
i just finished another ranked game it was eventful I played full tank Elise against a team of assassins {{champion:105}}  {{champion:238}}  {{champion:80}}  i tried to get across the idea that our comp of Cait adc, Ziggs sup, Lee sin top, Xerath mid, and Elise jg wouldnt fair well against there triple assassins comp. I'm not gonna rant about my team the game was ugly  our mid fed I tried to counter gank in the begging but I couldn't keep up with my lanners feeding. from the first time I ganked and got a kill stopping Fizz from getting the killing auto that would of first blooded our {{champion:101}} who was ignited. I thought I could help these teammates, but they were beyond help. 

I  hate playing a game i know I'm going to loose in order to chase LP especially when my teammates aren't even attempting to make the game a match. I cant  stand the 40min waste of my time energy composure. 

I want riot to add a optional dodge feature in champ select maybe 2 dodges per hour or so. its ridiculous how you can expect solo players to climb off this random team play.  I tilt pretty easy when it comes to this type of thing  i regret being toxic but its pretty funny how i try to communicate in a pre game lobby and they reply don't worry its fine. I'm duo bot gg :)  this champions really strong i just bought him.. Xddd or silence. 

Riot a dodge feature would be nice 

i would  love to chat about the positives and negatives of a dodge feature in the comment below.

replies.body:
In the early stages of League there was a dodge mechanic, however it was too RNG so it was removed.
And is now a special mechanic for Jax and Shen.

> [{quoted}](name=Shuyin178,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=m6qqnTyT,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-08-31T04:28:23.894+0000)
>
> In the early stages of League there was a dodge mechanic, however it was too RNG so it was removed.
> And is now a special mechanic for Jax and Shen

 i heard about that, but i mean a dodge queue feature to avoid these matches.
Yea, it's called logging out and logging back in.
